Authors: chen chen, Guangyu Sun, Mark L. Gleason
Title:
Neopeltaster gen. nov. associated with sooty blotch and
flyspeck on crabapple from China
Keywords:
SBFS, black yeast, Dothideomycetes, ectophyte,
epiphytic
Abstract:
Neopeltaster, typified by Neopeltaster mali, is introduced
as a new genus associated with the sooty blotch and flyspeck (SBFS)
fungal complex, based on morphology and nuclear ribosomal DNA phylogeny
(ITS, LSU). The genus is characterised by reduced, intercalary phialidic
conidiogenous cells with conspicuous collarettes. N. mali was obtained
from crabapple fruit from China that exhibited the punctate mycelial
type, and caused the same mycelial type on apple fruit after
inoculation.
